com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCTableBindingData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCTableBindingData

  • public class YRCTableBindingData
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of this class provide binding, behavioral and name information about Table controls.
    There are two types of tables, one is of type non-editable and the other is editable tables.
    a) Non-Editable Table (Normal):

    To bind a table first create an instance of class 'YRCTableBindingData'. Use the object to set the properties of the binding data. For a standard implementation refer to the illustration below.

    Structure of a sample model used for input: <Order> <OrderLines> <OrderLine ItemID="I001" Quantity="100" ...../> <OrderLine ItemID="I002" Quantity="90" ...../> <OrderLine ItemID="I003" Quantity="105" ...../> <OrderLine ItemID="I004" Quantity="2" ...../> </OrderLines> </Order> Binding of a Table involves binding of each column(of course, the ones that the table contains) individually and then set it as the TblClmBIndings to the TableBindingData.
    Example Code: //First create a Table Binding Data. YRCTableBindingData tblBindingData = new YRCTableBindingData(); //Coresponding to that table create an array of YRCTblClmBindingData[] with array size being // equal to the number of columns in the table. YRCTblClmBindingData clmBindingData[] = new YRCTblClmBindingData[#columns in the table]; //Now corresponding to each column in the table associate an attribute of the repeating element. clmBindingData[0] = new YRCTblClmBindingData(); clmBindingData[0].setAttributeBinding("ItemID"); //use the method setColumnBinding() to set the title of the table column. clmBindingData[0].setColumnBinding("item_id"); //Set the name of the Table Column. clmBindingData[0].setName("clmItemID"); //If the column needs to be sortable then do the following: clmBindingData[0].setSortReqd(true); //If the table column is to be localized from the database, then set the dbLocalise Attribute to true. clmBindingData[0].setDbLocaliseReqd(true); //repeat the process to create binding data for all columns in the table tblBindingData.setTargetBinding("/Order/@Quantity"); tblBindingData.setSourceBinding("Results:/OrderList/Order"); tblBindingData.setName("tblOrderList"); //Specify to the tableBindingData the initialized columnBindingData(s) using the method setTblClmBindings. tblBindingData.setTblClmBindings(clmBindingData); //Also specify on the table binding data that sort is required on the table. tblBindingData.setSortRequired(true); //setLinkProvider utility provides us the capability of links on the table. // Add the method to be executed when table link is selected. tblBindingData.setLinkProvider(new IYRCTableLinkProvider() { public String getLinkTheme(Object element, int columnIndex) { // return null, here means that a link is not required. return "TableLink"; } public void linkSelected(Object element, int columnIndex) { // Add the method/code to be called when the Link on the table column is selected. } }); //After all the binding properties are set in the tableBindingData object, set the data to the table. tblSearchResult.setData(YRCConstants.YRC_TABLE_BINDING_DEFINATION, tblBindingData); b)Editable Table:
    Binding of an editable table follows the same sequence as that of a non-editable table. For creating the table editable we need to create editors for the table columns.
    There are three types of cell editors defined in YRCConstants.
    For creating the editable cells, first create an array of celleditors with the size of the #table columns. Then create a specific cell for each column. e.g.
    Example Code:
    int noOfColumns = table.getColumnCount(); String[] editors = new String[noOfColumns]; editors[0] = YRCConstants.YRC_TEXT_BOX_CELL_EDITOR; editors[1] = YRCConstants.YRC_COMBO_BOX_CELL_EDITOR; // While, creating a combo box cell editor one has to create a YRCComboBindingData object // with the appropriate binding. // Then set the comboBindingData as the binding data of the corresponding table column, int noOfColumns = tblSearchResults.getColumnCount(); clm[3].setBindingData(oComboData); // After all the editors are initialized, set the cell type of the tableBindingData with the // editor as the input argument. e.g., String[] editors = new String[noOfColumns]; editors[0] = YRCConstants.YRC_TEXT_BOX_CELL_EDITOR; editors[1] = YRCConstants.YRC_COMBO_BOX_CELL_EDITOR; bindingData.setCellTypes(editors); The cells that are associated with table columns are the only ones which behave as a editable cell.
    See Also:
    YRCTblClmBindingData, YRCComboBindingData, YRCButtonBindingData, YRCTextBindingData, YRCConstants.YRC_COMBO_BOX_CELL_EDITOR, YRCConstants.YRC_TEXT_BOX_CELL_EDITOR, YRCConstants.YRC_CHECK_BOX_CELL_EDITOR

        public java.lang.String getSourceBinding()

        setSourceBinding(String)

      • setSourceBinding

        public void setSourceBinding(java.lang.String sourceBinding)
        Sets the source binding for the table. The source binding is the path to the repeating element in the table. In case of piped source binding, all paths must point to the repeating element having similar structure. The all paths will be used to derive the list of repeating elements from the same model, i.e. at any given point of time only model can be associated with the table.
        Parameters:
        sourceBinding -
